org.orgName: District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington

body.p: The alien produced a Canadian registration card issued to one Yan (his mark) Matveyeff, #41.111.423 at Suolburg, Ontario, June 22, 1918.
Head tax receipt, #14188 Form 569, Dated Victoria, B.C. August 31, 1919, signed by Edward Huestis;

also a School Tax Receipt, #13556, date October 20, 1919, showing receipt from J. Matthews of five dollars for school, 24 signed by C.W. Lloyd, school tax collector for town or school district of Blackburn (or Blackhen)
CERTIFICATE OF ADMISSION OF ALIEN U.S. DEPARTMENT OF LABOR IMMIGRATION SERVICE
I HEREBY CERTIFY that the following is a correct record and statement of facts relative to the admission to the United States of the alien named below:

(1) S.S., Canadian Border ; Line, G T P (2) Date arrival, August 31, 1919 ;Manifest No., 37530/77-19 Class, (3) Port at which admitted, Victoria, B.C. (4) Name, Matthews, John ; age, 27 ; sex, male (5) Married, no ; occupation, prospector ; able to read and write, yes (6) Nationality, Canada ; race, Polish (7) Last permanent residence, Sudberry, Ontario. (Nearest Relative, father Tony Matthews, Sudberry, Ontario.) (8) Destination, Lowell, Washington. (9) By whom the passage paid, self ; money brought, $80 (10) Whether in U.S. before, yes ; when, 1912-1914 ; where, Colo/Mich. (11) To whom going, Friend Mrs. E. Pendleman or ; condition of health, good (Rendleman) Lowell, Wash. (12) Height, 5/9 ; complexion, dark ; color of hair, brown (13) Color of eyes, brown ; identification marks, #195 (14) Place of birth, Warsaw, Poland ; examined by Inspector Huesties (15) How admitted, primary ; accompanied by, -- (16) Remarks: Issued Certificate Form 569a, No. 14188 on August 1, 1919; Manifested April 1920. Gives seaport for landing as New York, 1899, Steamship unknown
